li.text: For any changed settings to take effect the game must be restarted.
Core Tweaks

Replaces the mechanoid disassembly returns with accurate resources based on the resources required for gestating them. It also allows tweaking of the disassembly efficiency stat so the returns can be scaled down while remaining accurate.

Input a value to adjust the efficiency stats for Mechanoid Disassembly. The Max stat is the maximum percentage of resources acquirable while Base stat is the starting efficiency percentage before factoring in manipulation, eyesight and crafting skill.\nVanilla (1, 0.75).
Changes turrets to be rearmed even if they are 99% full of ammo.
Removes the action of eating random things for curiosity from animal AI logic trees.

Removes the action of mining through walls and rock to escape when hungry from animal AI logic trees. Instead they will now just starve to death.\nNote: This does not apply to Alpha Animals creatures who use the Animal Digger logic tree since they are designed to dig through things.
Allows you to customise how furniture quality effects the Bed Rest Effectiveness stat.
Move the slider to adjust the Bed Rest Effectiveness stat for that particular quality.\nVanilla (0.86, 0.92, 1.00, 1.08, 1.14, 1.25, 1.60).
Allows you to individually enable options that will add or change things in the quest reward pool.

li.label: Adds Hyperweave as a filler material.
Adds Jade as a filler material.
Adds Synthread as a filler material.

li.text: Allows you to customise how large rivers appear on maps.
Input a value to adjust the size of rivers.\nVanilla values (30, 14, 6, 4).
Allows ancient dangers to spawn on encounter maps.
Allows resources and deep drilling veins to spawn on encounter maps again.
Allows you to customise the speed of Moisture Pumps.
Input a value to adjust the speed of Moisture Pumps. The value is written in days.\nThe Vanilla value is 60 (1 year).

li.label: Filth Vanishes With Rain And Time

li.text: Changes all filth types so they disappear within 14-15 days and wash away with rain/snow. See the Filth Vanishes With Rain And Time workshop page for full details.
Removes the food poisoning chance from all RawTasty foods and Insect Jelly. Foods that use RawTasty are things like Berries, Milk and modded foods such as fruits.
Allows ambrosia to be researched and planted in growing zones.
Allows grass to be planted in growing zones.
Changes Glowstool, Agarilux and Timbershroom to be plantable crops. Glowstool and Agarilux have tweaked growth/yield so they are comparable to other crops.
Doubles the selection weight of Drop Pod raid strategies. Also removes the raid point scaling so drop pod raids are the same size as normal raids.

Modifies the duration of Environmental Events and increases the refire interval somewhat to compensate. This makes events overall harder as they last longer.\n\nCold Snap and Heat Wave x2 Duration, Toxic Fallout x4 Duration, Volcanic Winter x2.5 Min and x1.5 Max Duration, Drought (Vanilla Events Expanded) x1.7 Min and x3 Max Duration.
Removes the allowedBiomes tag on the Herd Migration event so it can trigger on any biome.
Makes power conduits immortal, they have no health and can't catch fire.
Allows you to multiply the power generation of Vanometric Power Cells by an input value.
Move the slider to adjust the multiplier of Vanometric Power Cells. The value is a straight multiplier, a value of 2 will double the original while 3 will triple it.\nThe Vanilla value is 1.

Allows you to individually enable options that will allow plants to be plantable under roofs, allow adjacent sowing and allow planting regardless of biome. These limitations ordinarily only appear on tree or tree like plants.

li.label: Allow plants to be planted under roofs.
Allow plants to be planted regardless of biome.

li.text: Changes long term foods like Pemmican and Packaged Survival Meals to be less desirable than normal meals.\nNote: Distance seems to be factored into food choice so for best results long term foods should be stored near other meals.\nWarning: This tweak may cause friendlies to pilfer your food supplies more as their preserved meals are considered less desirable.
Allows you to customise how frequently quests appear.

Input a value to adjust the amount of quests generated within a timeframe. The minSpacingDays (minimum days between quests) must allow the numIncidentsRange (number of quests) to fit within onDays (how many days before this block of quests ends) otherwise the game will throw errors.\nVanilla (12, 2, 3), Double Vanilla (12, 4, 1), Triple Vanilla (12, 6, 1), Daily (1, 1, 0.5).

Allows you to customise the number of slaves traders have for sale and makes it so you can request slave caravans. Also removes the Population Intent on slave trading so you always have a full selection of slaves regardless of your colony population.
Input a value to adjust the number of slaves traders have for sale\nDefault Setting 9-10.

Adds new items to the raid loot tables to add some more variety to the rewards for defeating raids. Raid loot is a stack of items given to a raider or a number of raiders to serve as a reward for deating them, this typically comes in the form of resources, medicine or drugs.
Changes the duration of all thoughts for banishing or rejecting people to expire instantly.
Adds Raw Fungus to the list of default disallowed ingredients on meals.

Changes every ThingDef to remove the defaultStorageSettings and changes the default priority to normal. Unlike the mod No Default Shelf Storage which intentionally looks for a ThingClass to target only storage items this patch goes for everything. This means it'll target things like Mortars, Sarcophaguses, Biosculpters, Growth Pods and more.
Changes the human generated filth Trash to vanish instantly.

Removes the weapon stats from all Ingestible and Resource items so they can no longer be used as weapons.\nNote: If enabled mid save this will cause errors if anyone has these items equipped. You can use the mod Character Editor to move items to the inventory to fix this.

Patches every faction adding autoflee false as a tag so they will never break or flee no matter how many people die.\nThis setting is best used in combination with other mods. See the No One Ever Flees workshop page for full details.
Allows you to pick which starting Player Factions should start the game with no completed research projects.

Removes all starting research from every Player Faction. This should work for all DLC and mods. If this is enabled then none of the following settings should be enabled.\nNote: This does not remove any research added by starting Scenarios.
Removes all starting research from the Player Colony Faction called New Arrivals which is used for industrial starting scenarios like Crashlanded.
Removes all starting research from the Player Tribal Faction called New Tribe which is used for tribal starting scenarios like Lost Tribe.

Randy is missing the fields TraderCaravanArrival, VisitorGroup, TravelerGroup, OrbitalTraderArrival. This is no doubt so it relies on his randomness. Unfortunately the randomness tends to result in not getting these events very often. This fix adds the fields from Cassandra so these events show up regularly. This is an addition not a replacement, so the original randomness aspect is also present. If Vanilla Psycasts Expanded is loaded this tweak also adds the fields to Basilicus Bestower, as he's an exact copy of Randy except for his unique ability.

Changes power armour to be airtight if it fully covers the head or body. Meaning when the body armour and helmet are worn together it provides full Toxic Environmental Resistance. The helmets will also provide immunity to Toxic Gas.
Changes rock and metal slag chunks to be stacklable and allows you to customise the stack limit.
Input values to adjust the stack limit.
Allows you to set a maximum radius pawns will search for a table when consuming ingestible items. This patches all items with a preferability except ones with NeverForNutrition.

Input a value to set a maximum radius pawns will search for a table when consuming ingestible items. This patches all items with a preferability except ones with NeverForNutrition.\nNote: If a table is within this radius they will go to it before consuming items so be careful not to set it too high. The default value of 75 is what I've found to be a nice middle ground.
Changes the texture drawing of crops like rice that have messy texture placement to be nice and uniform like corn.
Adds the patchleather recipe to the crafting spot allowing tribals an easier way to craft leather items.
Stops quests from hiding the bio of pawns given as rewards so you can decide if its worth doing the quest or not.
Allows you to customise the pathing cost of water and if the tiles are impassable.

Input a value to adjust the pathing cost of water tiles. The pathing cost is irrelevant if the terrain is set to impassable.\nPathing cost is a bit odd so you'll have to experiment with numbers. A cost of 4 gives 76% movement speed on a tile but 40 gives 25%.\nVanilla Values Shallow Water 30, Chest Deep Water 42, Deep Water 300.
Allows wild animals to mate so they become pregnant just like colony animals. Also removes the deterioration rate of fertilized eggs so they can survive outdoors.

Changes the FilthRate to 0, Petness to 1 and nuzzleMtbHours to 12 to match dogs allowing you to have clean, friendly, nuzzle happy wolves. Also adds mating pairs of Timber Wolves and Arctic Wolves for sale at faction bases so they're easy to acquire.

This is intended for games with a high ageing multiplier to ensure a steady supply of new marriage candidates. The maximum spawning age is capped at 25 but no minimum age is added to avoid breaking children spawning. The actual age of people should be between 13 and 25 however it should tend toward the average. The numbers can skew outside of that when parent/child relations are included. After spawning people will age at your set multiplier so you should see older pawns as time goes on provided they don't die and the game doesn't purge them.
